Package fi.tuni.prog3.junitorder

Class Order

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.prog3.junitorder.Order
public class Order extends Object
Author:
Tuan Anh Nguyen anh.5.nguyen@tuni.fi Represents an order that contains zero or more entries.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Order.Entry
    Represents an order entry that consists of an item and an item unit count.
    static class 
    Order.Item
    Represents an item that has a name and a unit price.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Order()
    Constructs an initially empty order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructs an initially empty order.

  • Method Details

    • addItems

      public boolean addItems(Order.Item item, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException
      Adds count units of an item to the order.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be added to the order.
      count - The number of units of the item to be added.
      Returns:
      true if the items were added without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to add is not positive.
      IllegalStateException - if an existing entry has the same item name but a different price than the added item.

    • addItems

      public boolean addItems(String name, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Adds count units of an item to the order.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item to be added to the order.
      count - The number of units of the item to be added.
      Returns:
      true if the items were added without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to add is not positive.
      NoSuchElementException - if the order does not contain an entry with the specified item name.

    • getEntries

      public List<Order.Entry> getEntries()
      Returns the order entries in their original adding order.
      Returns:
      A list of order entries.

    • getEntryCount

      public int getEntryCount()
      Returns the total number of entries in this order (sum of all entries' counts).
      Returns:
      The total number of entries in this order.

    • getTotalPrice

      public double getTotalPrice()
      Returns the total price of all items in the order.
      Returns:
      The total price of all items in the order.

    • removeItems

      public boolean removeItems(String name, int count) throws IllegalArgumentException, NoSuchElementException
      Removes count units of an item from the order.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the item to be removed from the order.
      count - The number of units of the item to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the items were removed without errors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the item unit count to remove is not positive or is larger than the corresponding existing entry's item unit count.
      NoSuchElementException - if the order does not contain an entry with the specified item name.
